newsitem.title: USA: Sundance Homes Q1 hurt by lower sales.
newsitem.headline: Sundance Homes Q1 hurt by lower sales.

text.p: Sundance Homes Inc attributed its loss for the December 31 first quarter to lower sales revenue and gross profit.

Gross profit as a percent of sales decreased to 7.7 percent from 9.3 percent a year ago. Sales fell $9.7 million to $22.7 million, or 131 homes, from $32.4 million, or 185 homes, for the 1995 quarter.
The company said selling, general and administrative expenses were 11.9 percent of sales compared to 7.9 percent in the prior-year period.

"Our results for the quarter were impacted by reduced gross profits at communities where we have offered incentives to close out the remaining homes," said chairman Maurice Sanderman. "We also incurred additional promotional expenses as a result of our three new communities, which opened for sale during the quarter."

The sales backlog as of December 31, 1996, was $32.3 million, or 186 homes, compared to $39.9 million, or 229 homes, as of December 31, 1995. "Our short-term results will continue to be affected by the close-out of certain communities. We expect closings in our new suburban and urban communities to begin to be realized in the third and fourth quarters of Fiscal 1997," Sanderman added.
